briefdescription.para: A Dictionary of the DeployedScienceCluster's in this save. Keyed by the ModuleGroundExpControl Part's PersistentId.
The Parent GameObject for the Missions GameObjects
A dictionary of the diminishing returns science multipliers. Key is the Number of the same experiment per CB. Value is the multiplier to apply to science for the key.
The singleton instance of DeployedScience
True if the DeployedScience Scenario is active.
The Impact rates J(oules) for each Celestial Body to register Science for the Seismic Sensor Experiment.
This is the experiment name for the Deployed Sesimic Sensor. Which processes seismic activity experiments when vessels crash into CBs.
How long to delay before attempting to resend Science Data
The Minimum amount of Energy Required for a Seismic Event to generate Science.
How often Science is processed for timed Deployed Science Experiments in secs.

There is a delay after the first impact is detected on a CB before the science is processed. This is to allow all parts of the vessel to hit the ground and generate data. Changing this value will change the length of that delay.

Deregister a DeployedScience Cluster (ModuleGroundExpControl) and all the deployable parts that are connected to it. This will also be Called automatically when GameEvent onGroundScienceDeregisterCluster is Fired.

Calculates and Returns the Diminishing Science Multiplier Rate based on the experimentId and Celestial Body name. Each additional Experiment on the same Celestial Body returns a diminishing amount of science.
Finds and returns the first matching DeployedSciencePart that has an experiment matching ExperimentId and deployed on the Celestial Body passed in. If none found will return null.
Will return the Diminishing Returns multiplier from the diminishing returns config based on the number passed in.

Register a DeployedScience Cluster (ModuleGroundExpControl) and all the deployable parts that are connected to it. This will also be Called automatically when GameEvent onGroundScienceRegisterCluster is Fired.

Will set the Diminishing Science Rate on all Deployed Science Experiments that match the ExperimentId and Celestial Body passed in. The First (highest) science returning experiment (based on buffs set based on traits for the kerbal that deployed it) returns a rate of 1. Then for each other instance of the same experiment a diminishing rate is applied based on what is defined in the Deployed Science cfg.

Do processing for deployed Central Station clusters based on this information to generate science over time during the progress of the game. Handle the injection of science data into the Science system via CommNet setup.IE: Checking CommNet connections for the cluster and processing appropriately.

This is triggered when a OnGameStateLoad or OnGameStatePostLoad event occurs. Which happens after Load. It checks all clusters and experiments that we have data objects for still exist in the game by checking FlightGlobals Loaded and Unloaded parts. We have to wait for these events and not do this in Load. Because the FlightState is loaded AFTER Scenario Module load. And we need the FlightGlobals Loaded and Unloaded parts to be loaded.
This will get triggered when a part is about to explode due to hitting the ground. Will initiate a check for a seismic experiment if one is deployed.

This will get triggered when a vessel is about to explode due to hitting the ground. Will initiate a check for a seismic experiment if one is deployed but only if the vessel is unloaded. If it is loaded the parts will call OnPartExplodeGroundCollision above.
This will get triggered when a vessel is recovered. If it's a Deployed Science Controller will deregister the science cluster which will remove the data objects for the cluster.
This will get triggered when a vessel is terminated. If it's a Deployed Science Controller will deregister the science cluster which will remove the data objects for the cluster.

This will get triggered when a vessel is about to be destroyed. It will check if the vessel is a Deployed Science Controller and if it is will deregister the science cluster which will remove the data objects for the cluster. Second - it will check if there is a Seismic sensor experiment deployed on the same CB as the vessel just crashing into the CB and if there is. It will calculate the experiment science and send it home.
Will Destroy MannedScience Game Objects.

Called when a part or vessel crashes into a CB. Checks if there is a deployed science cluster deployed on the same CB and if that cluster has a seismometer experiment. Will call all seismometer experiments found on the same CB to calculate science for the event.

memberdef.argsstring: (ModuleGroundExpControl controlUnit, bool replaceList, List< ModuleGroundSciencePart > deployableScienceParts)
memberdef.name: UpdateCluster

briefdescription.para: When a Cluster Update GameEvent occurs this will Add the Cluster if it is not Registered with the Scenario Module. - This Should Never really happen.
This will get triggered when a Science Part has it's Enabled state changed by the player. In which case, If it is a science experiment. We have to recalculate and set the diminishing science rates.
